operations.description: Operation that allows the user to publish a single MQTT3Message to a given exchange

parameters.description: the topic to which the message must be published
parameters.name: topic

parameters.description: the content of the message to be published
parameters.name: message

parameters.description: the QoS with which the message will be published
parameters.name: qos

parameters.description: whether the message should be retained by the broker
parameters.name: isRetained

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Set of error mappings

description.value: Determines that an error thrown by this operation should be mapped to another

parameters.name: errorMappings

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

operations.name: publish

parameters.description: The list of Topics that this listener will subscribe to.
parameters.name: topics

parameters.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster
parameters.name: primaryNodeOnly

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

description.value: The maximum number of times a message can be redelivered and processed unsuccessfully before triggering process-failed-message
The secure hashing algorithm to use. If not set, the default is SHA-256.
Defines which strategy is used to identify the messages.
Whether to use a secure hash algorithm to identify a redelivered message
Defines one or more expressions to use to determine when a message has been redelivered. This property may only be set if useSecureHash is false.
The object store where the redelivery counter for each message is going to be stored.

parameters.name: redeliveryPolicy

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy

externalLibraryModels.name: Eclipse Paho MQTT3
externalLibraryModels.description: Eclipse Paho MQTT3 client library for MQTT v3

connectionProviders.name: connection
connectionProviders.description: Cached Connection provider that creates MQTT Connections. Allows the user to specify a connection URL for the broker.

displayModel.summary: The generator used to create a connection's client id

parameters.description: A ClientIDGenerator that generates a Client ID to identify a connection to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: clientIDGenerator

displayModel.summary: The username used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker

parameters.description: Username to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: username

displayModel.summary: The password to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker

parameters.description: Password to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: password

displayModel.summary: The url to connect to

parameters.description: The url that represents the broker to connect to.
parameters.name: url

displayModel.summary: The TLS factory used to create TLS secured connections

description.value: A comma separated list of protocols enabled for this context.
A comma separated list of cipher suites enabled for this context.
Trust store configuration. If used client side, the trust store contains the certificates of the trusted servers. If used server side, it contains the certificates of the trusted clients.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the trust store.
The password used to protect the trust store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: The algorithm used by the trust store.
If true, no certificate validations will be performed, rendering connections vulnerable to attacks. Use at your own risk.
Key store configuration. The key store contains the keys of this server/client.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the key store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: When the key store contains many private keys, this attribute indicates the alias of the key that should be used. If not defined, the first key in the file will be used by default.
The password used to protect the private key.
The password used to protect the key store.
The algorithm used by the key store.

Uses the standard JVM certificate revocation checks, which depend on the certificate having the corresponding extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP), and the availability of revocation servers.
Only verify the last element of the certificate chain.
Try CRL instead of OCSP first.
Do not use the secondary checking method (the one not selected before).
Avoid verification failure when the revocation server can not be reached or is busy.

Uses a custom OCSP responder for certificate revocation checks, with a specific trusted certificate for revocating other keys. This ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP) present in the certificate, if any.
The URL of the OCSP responder.
Alias of the signing certificate for the OCSP response (must be in the trust store), if present.
Local file based certificate revocation checker, which requires a CRL file to be accessible and ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP and OCSP) in the certificate.
The path to the CRL file.

displayModel.summary: The topic to which the last will and testament message will be published

parameters.description: The topic to which the last will and testament message will be published.
parameters.name: topic

displayModel.summary: The content of the last will and testament message

parameters.description: The content of the last will and testament message.
parameters.name: body

displayModel.summary: The quality of service for the last will and testament message publish

parameters.description: The quality of service QoS with which the last will and testament message will be published. Defaults to AT_LEAST_ONCE
parameters.name: qos

displayModel.summary: Whether the last will and testament message should be retained by the broker

parameters.description: If set to true the last will and testament message will be retained by the broker.
parameters.name: isRetained

displayModel.summary: Socket connection timeout value

parameters.description: The socket connection timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit. In the case of multiple fail-over URLs provided, the timeout applies to each one individually.
parameters.name: connectionTimeout

displayModel.summary: Time unit to be used in the Timeout configurations

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout attribute. Defaults to SECONDS
parameters.name: timeoutUnit

displayModel.summary: The maximum amount of time for an inactive connection to be kept alive

parameters.description: The amount of time that the connection between client and broker will be kept alive without any messages being exchanged. If the keep-alive interval is 0, then the keep-alive mechanism is disabled.
parameters.name: keepAliveInterval

displayModel.summary: Time unit to be used as unit for the 'keepAliveInterval' parameter

parameters.description: The unit of time that corresponds to the keepAliveInterval parameter. Defaults to SECONDS
parameters.name: keepAliveIntervalUnit

displayModel.summary: The maximum amount of messages that can be unacknowledged at a given time

parameters.description: The maximum amount of messages that can be unacknowledged at a given time. Setting it to 0 means, there can be unlimited in-flight messages.
parameters.name: maxInFlight

displayModel.summary: Whether the session should be cleaned each time the client disconnects from the broker

parameters.description: If set to true, the session will be cleaned each time the client disconnects from the broker. Subscriptions will not be saved and offline (qos 1 and 2) messages for that client will be lost.
parameters.name: cleanSession

displayModel.summary: Whether a file-based persistent data store should be created to store in flight messages

parameters.description: If set to true, creates an file-based persistent data store, used to store outbound and inbound messages while they are in flight, enabling delivery to the QoS specified.
parameters.name: enableFilePersistence

displayModel.summary: The directory where the file-based persistent data store will be created if enableFilePersistence is set to true.

parameters.description: The directory where the file-based persistent data store will be created if enableFilePersistence is set to true.
parameters.name: dataStorePath

parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnection

externalLibraryModels.description: Eclipse Paho MQTT3 client library for MQTT v3

displayModel.summary: The username used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker

parameters.description: Username to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: username

displayModel.summary: The password to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker

parameters.description: Password to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: password

displayModel.summary: The list of server URLs to iterate over until a connection to the broker is successfully established

parameters.description: The list of server URLs that will be used to (attempt to) establish a connection to the broker.
parameters.name: failOverServers

displayModel.summary: The TLS factory used to create TLS secured connections

description.value: A comma separated list of protocols enabled for this context.
A comma separated list of cipher suites enabled for this context.
Trust store configuration. If used client side, the trust store contains the certificates of the trusted servers. If used server side, it contains the certificates of the trusted clients.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the trust store.
The password used to protect the trust store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: The algorithm used by the trust store.
If true, no certificate validations will be performed, rendering connections vulnerable to attacks. Use at your own risk.
Key store configuration. The key store contains the keys of this server/client.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the key store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: When the key store contains many private keys, this attribute indicates the alias of the key that should be used. If not defined, the first key in the file will be used by default.
The password used to protect the private key.
The password used to protect the key store.
The algorithm used by the key store.

Uses the standard JVM certificate revocation checks, which depend on the certificate having the corresponding extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP), and the availability of revocation servers.
Only verify the last element of the certificate chain.
Try CRL instead of OCSP first.
Do not use the secondary checking method (the one not selected before).
Avoid verification failure when the revocation server can not be reached or is busy.

Uses a custom OCSP responder for certificate revocation checks, with a specific trusted certificate for revocating other keys. This ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP) present in the certificate, if any.
The URL of the OCSP responder.
Alias of the signing certificate for the OCSP response (must be in the trust store), if present.
Local file based certificate revocation checker, which requires a CRL file to be accessible and ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP and OCSP) in the certificate.
The path to the CRL file.

displayModel.summary: The topic to which the last will and testament message will be published

parameters.description: The topic to which the last will and testament message will be published.
parameters.name: topic

displayModel.summary: The content of the last will and testament message

parameters.description: The content of the last will and testament message.
parameters.name: body

displayModel.summary: The quality of service for the last will and testament message publish

parameters.description: The quality of service QoS with which the last will and testament message will be published. Defaults to AT_LEAST_ONCE
parameters.name: qos

displayModel.summary: Whether the last will and testament message should be retained by the broker

parameters.description: If set to true the last will and testament message will be retained by the broker.
parameters.name: isRetained

displayModel.summary: Socket connection timeout value

parameters.description: The socket connection timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit. In the case of multiple fail-over URLs provided, the timeout applies to each one individually.
parameters.name: connectionTimeout

displayModel.summary: Time unit to be used in the Timeout configurations

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout attribute. Defaults to SECONDS
parameters.name: timeoutUnit

displayModel.summary: The maximum amount of time for an inactive connection to be kept alive

parameters.description: The amount of time that the connection between client and broker will be kept alive without any messages being exchanged. If the keep-alive interval is 0, then the keep-alive mechanism is disabled.
parameters.name: keepAliveInterval

displayModel.summary: Time unit to be used as unit for the 'keepAliveInterval' parameter

parameters.description: The unit of time that corresponds to the keepAliveInterval parameter. Defaults to SECONDS
parameters.name: keepAliveIntervalUnit

displayModel.summary: The maximum amount of messages that can be unacknowledged at a given time

parameters.description: The maximum amount of messages that can be unacknowledged at a given time. Setting it to 0 means, there can be unlimited in-flight messages.
parameters.name: maxInFlight

displayModel.summary: Whether the session should be cleaned each time the client disconnects from the broker

parameters.description: If set to true, the session will be cleaned each time the client disconnects from the broker. Subscriptions will not be saved and offline (qos 1 and 2) messages for that client will be lost.
parameters.name: cleanSession

displayModel.summary: Whether a file-based persistent data store should be created to store in flight messages

parameters.description: If set to true, creates an file-based persistent data store, used to store outbound and inbound messages while they are in flight, enabling delivery to the QoS specified.
parameters.name: enableFilePersistence

displayModel.summary: The directory where the file-based persistent data store will be created if enableFilePersistence is set to true.

parameters.description: The directory where the file-based persistent data store will be created if enableFilePersistence is set to true.
parameters.name: dataStorePath

parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnection

externalLibraryModels.name: Eclipse Paho MQTT3
externalLibraryModels.description: Eclipse Paho MQTT3 client library for MQTT v3

connectionProviders.name: form
connectionProviders.description: Cached Connection provider that creates MQTT Connections. Allows the user to specify a protocol, host and port to establish a connection with the broker.

displayModel.summary: The generator used to create a connection's client id

parameters.description: A ClientIDGenerator that generates a Client ID to identify a connection to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: clientIDGenerator

displayModel.summary: The username used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker

parameters.description: Username to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: username

displayModel.summary: The password to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker

parameters.description: Password to be used when providing authentication credentials to the MQTT broker.
parameters.name: password

displayModel.summary: The protocol to be used when connecting to the broker

parameters.description: The protocol to be used when connecting to the broker. Defaults to TCP
parameters.name: protocol

displayModel.summary: The host of the broker to connect to

parameters.description: The host of the broker to connect to.
parameters.name: host

displayModel.summary: The broker's port to connect to

parameters.description: The broker's port to connect to.
parameters.name: port
